Adam Obaid
About

About

In 2016 I joined the Computational EM Lab at McGill University to conduct research in numerical algorithms design & analysis for my master’s degree. I published a set of algorithms to compute EM radiations in complex geometry more accurately.

In 2017 I started working as a software developer at MicrowaveSoft, a startup company that specializes in communication services and products. I developed scalable predictive algorithms to model RF radiations.

In 2019 I joined Cerence Inc. as NLU Software Analyst, where I worked on coversational AI and NLU systems for in-vehicle Intelligent Assistant. I analyzed language models and improved the accuracy of NLU/NLP components in collaboration with research scientists.

I’m interested in Software Developement, Sequence modeling (NLP, Time-Series)

Education

  • MSc. in Electrical Engineering, McGill University, 2017
  • BSc. in Electrical & Computer Engineering, American University of the Middle East, 2015

  • Research Assistant: Numerical Algorithms Design (Jan 2016 - June 2017) McGill University - Computational Electromagnetics(CEM) Lab
    • Adaptive Algorithms design for EM wave problems (FEA)
